Clubs.About: GDGoC GEC Patan (Google Developer Groups on Campus) is the official on-campus chapter at Government Engineering College, Patan. It serves as a platform for students to explore, learn, and collaborate on Google technologies like Android, Firebase, Google Cloud, and more. The club organizes various events including workshops, meetups, hackathons, and flagship events like Google I/O Extended. Students can participate by attending these events, following the club on social media, or engaging in hands-on learning experiences. GDGoC GEC Patan offers a vibrant community for aspiring developers to connect, grow, and enhance their skills under expert guidance.
Clubs.Title: GDGoC
SubObjectives: Foster Learning: Encourage continuous learning and exploration of Google technologies through workshops, study jams, and hands-on sessions.
Promote Collaboration: Build a vibrant community where students can share ideas, collaborate on projects, and solve real-world problems together.
Enhance Skill Development: Offer training and resources to improve technical skills in areas like web development, cloud computing, AI/ML, and app development.
Encourage Open Source Contribution: Motivate students to contribute to open-source projects and participate in programs like Google Summer of Code.
Build Networking Opportunities: Connect students with industry experts and experienced developers through talks, webinars, and mentorship.
Organize Engaging Events: Host events such as Google I/O Extended, hackathons, and tech meetups to broaden exposure and inspire innovation.
Promote Diversity & Inclusion: Create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to learn, share, and grow.

Clubs.About: Code Hives Club is a community for tech enthusiasts to learn programming, attend workshops, participate in hackathons, and collaborate on coding projects. It’s a great space for beginners and experienced developers to improve their skills and network
Clubs.Title: Code Hives
SubObjectives: Learning and Development: Providing opportunities for members to learn programming languages, tools, and technologies through structured courses, workshops, and hands-on projects.
Community Building: Fostering a supportive and inclusive community where tech enthusiasts of all skill levels can connect, share knowledge, and collaborate on various coding projects.
Skill Enhancement: Offering a variety of events such as hackathons, coding challenges, and seminars that enable members to practice and improve their coding skills in a real-world setting.
Networking Opportunities: Creating a platform for members to network with industry professionals, mentors, and peers, thereby facilitating career growth and professional development.
Innovation and Creativity: Encouraging members to think creatively and innovate by providing them with the resources and environment to work on unique and challenging coding projects.
Career Support: Assisting members in their career journey by offering guidance, resume building workshops, interview preparation sessions, and job placement opportunities.

Clubs.About: The rapid advancement in semiconductor technology and the increasing demand for integrated circuits have made VLSI design a key area of modern electronics. To encourage innovation, hands-on learning, and industry readiness, a dedicated VLSI Club is proposed in the Electronics and Communication Department. The club will provide a platform for students to explore VLSI concepts, tools, and real-world applications through workshops, projects, competitions, and interactions with industry experts. It aims to bridge the gap between academic knowledge and industry practices in chip design and fabrication.
Clubs.Title: VLSI Club
SubObjectives: To promote awareness and understanding of VLSI design and its applications.
To provide hands-on experience with industry-standard tools such as Cadence, Synopsys, and Xilinx.
To encourage collaborative projects and research in digital and analog IC design.
To organize technical events, seminars, and competitions to enhance learning.
To build connections with academia and industry professionals.

Clubs.About: The Sanchar Mitra Scheme is a national volunteer program launched by the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), Government of India to engage youth as digital ambassadors for telecom awareness, digital safety, and secure communication practices. Under this initiative, selected students from colleges and universities are designated as Sanchar Mitras and trained to educate citizens about safe and responsible use of telecom services and digital technologies.
Clubs.Title: Sanchar Mitra
SubObjectives: To create public awareness about the Sanchar Saathi portal and its citizen-centric telecom security services.
To educate mobile users on reporting fraudulent communications such as calls, SMS, WhatsApp messages, and malicious links through the Chakshu module.
To help citizens verify mobile connections issued in their name using the TAFCOP service and report unauthorized numbers.
To promote checking of handset genuineness using IMEI through the KYM (Know Your Mobile) feature.
To assist users in blocking and tracking lost or stolen mobile phones using the CEIR facility.
To spread awareness about international spoofed calls appearing as Indian numbers and encourage reporting of such calls.
To guide citizens in identifying authorized broadband service providers through the Wireline ISP search feature.
To promote the use of trusted contact details of banks and institutions to prevent financial fraud.
To strengthen digital safety and cyber awareness among students, senior citizens, and the general public.
To act as a bridge between the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) and citizens for safer and more secure telecom usage.

Clubs.About: AnimFX Club is a community focused on animation and visual effects (VFX). It offers workshops, collaborative projects, and networking opportunities for members interested in animation, 3D modeling, and VFX. It's a great place to learn, create, and connect with others in the field
Clubs.Title: AnimFx

Clubs.About: AlgoZenith Club is a community focused on competitive programming and algorithms. It offers coding competitions, workshops, and collaborative learning opportunities to help members improve their problem-solving skills.
Clubs.Title: AlgoZenith
